{"step_by_step_thinking": "The wrist joint is formed by the articulation of multiple bones. The two main bones that form the wrist joint are the radius and the ulna. The radius is located on the thumb side of the forearm, while the ulna is located on the pinky side. The scaphoid and triquetrum are two of the eight carpal bones that make up the wrist. Therefore, the bone that does not form the wrist joint is the scaphoid.", "answer_choice": "C"}
